qas.question: In what year did Herschel publish his work on infrared radiation?
To whom did Herschel present his work on infrared radiation?
What device did Herschel use to discover the infrared?
What did Herschel call the infrared spectrum?
When did the term Calorific Rays start to be used?
What did Herschel use to detect light from the sun?
What did Herschel refract from Calorific Rays?
What society did Herschel present his work on the red spectrum?

context: The discovery of infrared radiation is ascribed to <a0_0><b5_0>William Herschel<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the astronomer, in the early 19th century. Herschel published his results in <a1_0>1800<a1_0/> before <a2_0><b9_0>the Royal Society of London<b9_0/><a2_0/>. Herschel used <a3_0><b7_0>a prism<b7_0/><a3_0/> to refract <b8_0>light<b8_0/> from the sun and detected the infrared, beyond the red part of the spectrum, through an increase in the temperature recorded on a thermometer. He was surprised at the result and called them "<a4_0>Calorific Rays<a4_0/>". The term 'Infrared' did not appear until <b6_0>late in the 19th century<b6_0/>.
